item.title: 霍博肯称遭受网络攻击，服务暂停
item.description: 新泽西州霍博肯市表示，在遭受勒索软件攻击后，该市暂停了部分服务。【原文：The New Jersey city of Hoboken said it suspended some services after it was the victim of a ransomware attack.】

item.title: 特朗普胜选后中国出人意料地继续购买美国大豆
item.description: 中国仍在继续购买美国大豆，这让一些交易商感到困惑，他们曾预计在两国可能爆发贸易战之前，美国大豆的运输量会放缓。【原文：China is continuing to buy US soybeans, confounding some traders who had expected the flow of shipments to slow down ahead of a potential trade war between both countries.】

item.title: 阿波罗支持的 ABC 技术公司即将以 10 亿英镑收购德州仪器流体公司
item.description: 据熟悉收购要约的人士透露，ABC 科技控股公司（ABC Technologies Holdings Inc.【原文：ABC Technologies Holdings Inc. is nearing an agreement to buy British manufacturer TI Fluid Systems Plc for roughly £1 billion ($1.3 billion), according to people familiar with the offer.】

item.title: 特朗普的关税计划威胁美国汽油价格上涨
item.description: 即将上台的特朗普政府计划对从加拿大和墨西哥进口的产品征收关税，美国驾车者应做好汽油价格上涨的准备。【原文：US motorists should brace for a hike in gasoline prices under the incoming Trump administration plans to slap tariffs on imports of products from Canada and Mexico.】

item.title: 美国小姐运营商申请破产
item.description: 美国小姐选美比赛的运营公司因所有权法律纠纷申请破产。【原文：The company that runs the Miss America beauty pageant filed for bankruptcy following a legal dispute over its ownership.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚将 2024 年预算削减 5.6%，财政忧虑与日俱增
item.description: 哥伦比亚政府表示，在税收低于预期的情况下，将把 2024 年预算削减 5.6%，以遵守支出限制。【原文：Colombia’s government said it would cut the 2024 budget by 5.6% in an effort to comply with spending limits amid lower-than-expected tax revenue.】

item.title: 摩尔多瓦在担心天然气供应危机之际呼吁西方援助
item.description: 由于担心俄罗斯天然气工业股份公司（Gazprom PJSC）不会继续向该国分离的德涅斯特河左岸地区供应天然气，摩尔多瓦呼吁西方国家提供财政支持。【原文：Moldova called on Western countries for financial support on concern Gazprom PJSC won’t continue natural gas supplies to the nation’s breakaway Transnistria region.】

item.title: Zoom 提供 1800 万美元，以解决 SEC 从 2020 年开始的隐私调查问题
item.description: Zoom Communications Inc. 已出资 1800 万美元，以了结美国证券交易委员会对其隐私政策和通信问题长达四年的调查。【原文：Zoom Communications Inc. has offered $18 million to settle a four-year-old US Securities and Exchange Commission probe related to its privacy policies and communications.】

item.title: 人工智能聊天机器人成为五角大楼酝酿争端的焦点
item.description: 2023 年 4 月 21 日星期五，美国弗吉尼亚州阿灵顿的五角大楼。两党参议员在就十年来最大的机密文件泄露事件举行闭门简报会后，呼吁改变美国政府的机密信息分类系统。【原文：The Pentagon building in Arlington, Virginia, US, on Friday, April 21, 2023. Senators from both parties called for changes to the US government's system for classifying secret information after a closed-door briefing on the biggest leak of closely held documents in a decade.】

item.title: 美国抵押贷款利率下降，潜在购房者压力减轻
item.description: 美国的抵押贷款利率下降，为有意购房者提供了一个亮点。【原文：Mortgage rates in the US declined, offering a bright spot for would-be homebuyers.】

item.title: 因电动汽车不景气，斯特兰蒂斯不断削减意大利的汽车产量
item.description: 由于意大利市场对其生产的电动车和豪华车需求疲软，Stellantis NV 将从下周起减少在意大利的产量。【原文：Stellantis NV is reducing output in Italy starting next week due to weak demand for the electric and luxury cars it’s producing there.】

item.title: 全球支付公司考虑出售薪资系统和活跃网络
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，Global Payments 公司在今年早些时候进行战略审查后，正在权衡剥离其薪资和 Active Network 业务。【原文：Global Payments Inc. is weighing divestitures of its payroll and Active Network businesses following a strategic review earlier this year, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: PE 公司 Parcom 拟以 10 亿欧元出售屠夫集团
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士称，Parcom Capital Management 正在考虑出售 Group of Butchers，这笔交易可能会使这家肉类供应商的价值达到约 10 亿欧元（11 亿美元）。【原文：Parcom Capital Management is considering selling Group of Butchers in a deal that could value the meat supplier at about €1 billion ($1.1 billion), people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 巴西卢拉寻求在削减公共开支的同时免除所得税
item.description: 巴西总统路易斯-伊纳西奥-卢拉-达席尔瓦（Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva）希望在削减公共开支的同时提出一项所得税减免计划，因为投资者对巴西的财政政策日益担忧。【原文：Brazil President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva wants to present a plan for income tax exemptions alongside public spending cuts, as investors grow increasingly worried over the nation’s fiscal policy.】

item.title: 摩根大通看好美股，预计 2025 年 S&P 500 指数将上扬
item.description: 摩根大通公司（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：JPMorgan Chase & Co.’s equity strategy team, led for years by Marko Kolanovic until his departure earlier in 2024, has turned positive on US stocks.】

item.title: Trafigura 为 LME 金属提供巨额订单震撼锌市场
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，特拉菲古拉集团已从伦敦金属交易所的仓库中订购了数千吨锌，从而推动了锌价的上涨。【原文：Trafigura Group has ordered thousands of tons of zinc out of London Metal Exchange warehouses, fueling a rally in prices, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 纳米比亚称欧盟倡议延迟影响绿色债券发行
item.description: 由于欧盟为帮助发展中市场发行债券而提出的一项倡议受挫，纳米比亚出售绿色债券以资助可再生能源和氢能项目的计划被推迟。【原文：Namibia’s plans to sell green bonds to fund renewable energy and hydrogen projects have been delayed due to setbacks with a European Union initiative established to help developing markets with issuances.】

item.title: 无人驾驶技术公司 Pony AI 在美国上市后股价上涨 19
item.description: Pony AI 公司的美国存托股票在首次公开募股和同时进行的私募中募集了 4.134 亿美元，在推迟一周定价后，首次交易大涨 19%。【原文：Pony AI Inc.’s American depositary shares jumped 19% in their trading debut after raising $413.4 million in an initial public offering and concurrent private placements, after delaying the pricing by a week.】

item.title: 供应悬崖逼近，南非正就卡塔尔天然气交易进行谈判
item.description: 南非正在就从卡塔尔获得液化天然气进行谈判，因为未来几年南非将面临来自邻国莫桑比克的天然气供应减少的问题。【原文：South Africa is in talks to obtain liquefied natural gas from Qatar as the country faces a decline in supplies from neighboring Mozambique in the coming years.】

item.title: 比特币恢复上涨，重燃 100,000 美元里程碑乐观情绪
item.description: 比特币再次向难以企及的 100,000 美元价位攀升，结束了自唐纳德-特朗普赢得总统选举引发最大加密货币破纪录反弹以来的最长跌势。【原文：Bitcoin is climbing back toward the elusive $100,000 price level again, snapping its longest losing since Donald Trump’s presidential victory triggered a record-breaking rally in the largest cryptocurrency.】

item.title: 匈牙利央行继任令市场不安，福林下滑
item.description: 匈牙利福林跌至两年来的新低，因为投资者在紧张地等待总理维克多-欧尔班对下一任央行行长的人选。【原文：The Hungarian forint slid to a fresh two-year low as investors nervously awaited Prime Minister Viktor Orban’s choice of the next central bank governor.】

item.title: 由 Tether 支持的北方数据公司（Northern Data）获得加密货币挖矿臂报价
item.description: 北方数据公司（Northern Data AG）越来越接近达成出售其加密货币采矿业务的交易，因为该公司希望利用11月份比特币的涨势。【原文：Northern Data AG is getting closer to a deal to sell its crypto mining operations as the company looks to capitalize on November’s Bitcoin rally.】

item.title: 肯-格里芬将芝加哥打折公寓卖给克星普利兹克
item.description: J.B. 普利兹克购买了他的政治克星肯-格里芬（Ken Griffin）最近在芝加哥出售的两套豪华公寓。【原文：J.B. Pritzker purchased the two ritzy condos his political nemesis Ken Griffin recently sold in Chicago.】

item.title: 三名美国人在中国囚犯交换中获释
item.description: 据一位熟悉此事的人士透露，作为拜登政府与中国政府交换囚犯的一部分，中国释放了三名美国人，这是对手之间罕见的合作时刻。【原文：China released three Americans as part of a prisoner swap between the Biden administration and the Chinese government, according to a person familiar with the matter, a rare moment of cooperation between the adversaries.】

item.title: 波兰央行行长称 2025 年大幅减税空间不大
item.description: 波兰央行副行长表示，随着工资和消费价格推动通胀以及经济增长加速，波兰明年大幅降息的空间不大。【原文：Poland has little room for significant interest rate cuts next year with wages and consumer prices buoying inflation and economic growth accelerating, the country’s deputy central bank chief said.】

item.title: 土耳其称通胀放缓将减少对里拉的干预
item.description: 据熟悉讨论情况的人士透露，土耳其央行的一位高级官员本周告诉国际投资者，当局预计随着时间的推移将减少对外汇市场的干预。【原文：A senior Turkish central banker told international investors this week that authorities expect to intervene less in the foreign-exchange market over time, according to people familiar with the discussions.】

item.title: 美国在指控马杜罗选举舞弊后制裁其更多助手
item.description: 美国制裁了 21 名官员，称他们支持委内瑞拉总统尼古拉斯-马杜罗蔑视选举结果的行为。【原文：The US sanctioned 21 officials it said supported Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro’s effort to defy results of an election that the country’s opposition and Washington say he lost.】

item.title: 肯尼亚计划征收公园入园费资助野生动物保护
item.description: 肯尼亚以标志性的野生动物园而闻名，野生动物园的动物包括角马、大象和狮子，肯尼亚计划对公园、保护区和保护地的门票征收 1%的税，用于野生动物保护。【原文：Kenya, known for iconic safaris featuring animals from wildebeests to elephants and lions, plans to charge a 1% levy on entry fees to parks, reserves and conservancies to fund wildlife conservation.】

item.title: 墨西哥警告特朗普其严厉关税将重创美国经济
item.description: 大量失业和更昂贵的皮卡：据墨西哥政府称，这就是唐纳德-特朗普威胁要对邻国征收的高额关税对美国意味着什么。【原文：Massive job losses and more expensive pickup trucks: That’s what the steep tariffs Donald Trump is threatening to slap on his neighbors will mean for the US, according to Mexico’s government.】

item.title: 维克托-什韦茨：为什么这次真的不同？
item.description:
高度金融化的世界即将发生混乱。【原文：

Disruptions are coming to a highly financialized world.

】
